verses.kjv: And it came to pass the same year, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fourth year, and in the fifth month, that Hananiah the son of Azur the prophet, which was of Gibeon, spake unto me in the house of the LORD, in the presence of the priests and of all the people, saying,
verses.ct: That same year — in the 4th year of King Zedekiah of Judah's reign, during the 5th month — the prophet Hananiah son of Azur, who was from Gibeon, spoke to me in the LORD's temple while the priests and all the people were present. He said,

verses.kjv: Thus speaketh the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, saying, I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.
verses.ct: "This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, declares: 'I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.

verses.kjv: Within two full years will I bring again into this place all the vessels of the LORD’s house, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place, and carried them to Babylon:
verses.ct: Within 2 full years I will bring back to this place all the articles from the LORD's temple that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon removed from here and carried off to Babylon.

verses.kjv: And I will bring again to this place Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, with all the captives of Judah, that went into Babylon, saith the LORD: for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.
verses.ct: I will also bring back to this place Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, along with all the exiles from Judah who were taken to Babylon,' declares the LORD, 'because I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.'"

verses.kjv: Then the prophet Jeremiah said unto the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests, and in the presence of all the people that stood in the house of the LORD,
verses.ct: Then the prophet Jeremiah responded to the prophet Hananiah while the priests and all the people standing in the LORD's temple were watching.

verses.kjv: Even the prophet Jeremiah said, Amen: the LORD do so: the LORD perform thy words which thou hast prophesied, to bring again the vessels of the LORD’s house, and all that is carried away captive, from Babylon into this place.
verses.ct: The prophet Jeremiah said, "Yes! May the LORD do exactly that! May the LORD fulfill the words you have prophesied by bringing back the articles of the LORD's temple and all the exiles from Babylon to this place.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless hear thou now this word that I speak in thine ears, and in the ears of all the people;
verses.ct: But listen carefully to what I'm about to say to you and to all the people:

verses.kjv: The prophets that have been before me and before thee of old prophesied both against many countries, and against great kingdoms, of war, and of evil, and of pestilence.
verses.ct: The prophets who came before both of us in ancient times prophesied war, disaster, and plague against many countries and powerful kingdoms.

verses.kjv: The prophet which prophesieth of peace, when the word of the prophet shall come to pass, then shall the prophet be known, that the LORD hath truly sent him.
verses.ct: When a prophet predicts peace, only after that prediction actually comes true can that prophet be recognized as someone the LORD has genuinely sent."

verses.kjv: Then Hananiah the prophet took the yoke from off the prophet Jeremiah’s neck, and brake it.
verses.ct: At that point, the prophet Hananiah grabbed the yoke off the prophet Jeremiah's neck and snapped it in two.

verses.kjv: And Hananiah spake in the presence of all the people, saying, Thus saith the LORD; Even so will I break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon from the neck of all nations within the space of two full years. And the prophet Jeremiah went his way.
verses.ct: Then Hananiah declared in front of all the people, "This is what the LORD says: 'In the same way, I will break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon from the neck of every nation within 2 full years.'" The prophet Jeremiah then walked away.

verses.kjv: Then the word of the LORD came unto Jeremiah the prophet, after that Hananiah the prophet had broken the yoke from off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
verses.ct: After the prophet Hananiah had broken the yoke from the prophet Jeremiah's neck, the LORD's message came to Jeremiah:

verses.kjv: Go and tell Hananiah, saying, Thus saith the LORD; Thou hast broken the yokes of wood; but thou shalt make for them yokes of iron.
verses.ct: "Go tell Hananiah that this is what the LORD says: 'You have broken yokes made of wood, but you will replace them with yokes made of iron.'

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; I have put a yoke of iron upon the neck of all these nations, that they may serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and they shall serve him: and I have given him the beasts of the field also.
verses.ct: For this is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: 'I have placed an iron yoke on the necks of all these nations so that they will serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon — and serve him they will. I have even given him the wild animals.'"

verses.kjv: Then said the prophet Jeremiah unto Hananiah the prophet, Hear now, Hananiah; The LORD hath not sent thee; but thou makest this people to trust in a lie.
verses.ct: Then the prophet Jeremiah said to the prophet Hananiah, "Listen to me, Hananiah! The LORD did not send you. You are causing these people to put their trust in a lie.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD; Behold, I will cast thee from off the face of the earth: this year thou shalt die, because thou hast taught rebellion against the LORD.
verses.ct: So this is what the LORD says: 'Pay attention — I am about to remove you from the surface of the earth. You will die this very year because you have promoted rebellion against the LORD.'"

verses.kjv: So Hananiah the prophet died the same year in the seventh month.
verses.ct: The prophet Hananiah died that same year, in the 7th month.
